result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randi J Piesik

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:16 PM Defendant Randi J Piesik in court, in custody.  Attorney (Atty) Jared Redfield in court for Randi J Piesik.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Officer Nissen who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Atty Redfield cross exam.
No further questions, no further witnesses.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion and Order to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Anne Renc (sent to Br 3 Judge on 09/19/22 sp)

Jared Redfield.
Submitted 9/19/2022 at 2:26 PM.

Adjustment Number: 22A 067234,
Payable Number: 63227,
Receipt Number: 22R 009245,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Randi J Piesik in court, in custody, Portage County Jail.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Randi J Piesik.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

9:18 AM Court calls case.
Atty Dodge states appearances. 

Matter is set for an initial appearance.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.

Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Defense requests a preliminary hearing.
Address of Defendant is verified. 
Court informs Defendant his right to counsel. 

Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.

Defendant requests to appear to all his future court dates.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:37 PM Defendant Randi J Piesik appeared by video, in custody at Waupaca County Jail.  Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of  Attorney Anne Renc for Randi J Piesik.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Soule has not had the opportunity to contact the defendant to review the complaint.
Atty Soule would ask for an adjournment on behalf of Atty Renc.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Case is adjourned.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Atty Anne Renc
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Anne Renc
Initial Appearance set for 08/15/22 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 1
Summons filed to reschedule the Hearing to August 15, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 1

Do not operate a motor vehicle including a motorcycle without a valid license. 
Maintain absolute sobriety
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Participate in the Portage County Justice Programs and comply with the requirements for assessment and reporting.

12:09 PM Defendant Randi Piesik appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of WI.  Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping, Misdemeanor Bail Jumping, OWI 5th Offense, PAC as a 5th Offense.
Atty soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Atty Anne Renc currently represents this defendant in other cases.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $3,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule would request a lower cash bond and states her reasons on the record.  Defendant states that he has $500 he can post at this time.
Court sets a $2,000 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
